{"step_by_step_thinking": "Working mothers (A) do not necessarily put an infant at risk. It depends on the environment and care provided to the child. Not taking 100 days of folic acid (B) can put the fetus at risk of neural tube defects, but it doesn't necessarily put the infant at risk after birth. Preclampsia during pregnancy (C) can lead to complications such as premature birth and low birth weight, which can put the infant at risk. Malpresentation during birth (D), such as breech presentation, can lead to complications during delivery and can put the infant at risk.", "answer_choice": "C"}
